g.text: Escalera-Moreno and Baldoví Decoherence on Single-Molecule Quantum Processors
in the form of two hydrogen atoms would couple to the Gd
ion. Of course, this would deserve further investigation, since
the forced removal of this apical water molecule could result
in an enhanced coherence for the three qubits encoded in the
. In fact, a family of lanthanide-based
POMs with a similar coordination environment but excluding
the apical water molecule has recently been theoretically explored
oﬀer a promising platform to design a robust single-molecule
The successful realization of algorithms in a quantum processor
will critically depend on our ability of entangling a large enough
set of qubits while keeping information under processing safe
from decoherence. As far as spatial organization for a proper
qubit entanglement is concerned, molecular spin qubits are
promising candidates by exploiting chemical tailoring. In this
whose low-lying magnetic energy scheme allows deﬁning three
spin qubits and thus could be harnessed as a minimal quantum
processor. Complex algorithms will require the interplay of an
increasing number of close copies of
communication. Hence, we estimated the eﬀect of magnetic
noise on the encoded quantum information, since it becomes
more important when increasing the spatial concentration of the
magnetic POM. Our results reveal that there exists a noticeable
presence of magnetic noise. Indeed, on one hand the estimates
s due to the magnetic nuclei bath are two orders
of magnitude above the experimentally-reported phase memory
s, and thus this bath should play a minor role
on qubit coherence. On the other hand, the estimates
s but yet are not coincident.
Thus, everything suggests that the experimental
not only limited by this decoherence source but rather by a set
of competing mechanisms where it could be included. Among
low-energy modes could play a major role due to the proximity
6 K. The origin of this mechanism could be found in
long-wavelength crystal vibrations but especially also in the
relatively-little-restricted motion of the apical water molecule
be complemented with rotations of the water molecule itself,
which would result in a new decoherence source due to the
magnetic nature of hydrogen atom nuclei. By all means, these
observations deserve a deeper research of this POMto get further
insight on the role played by this coordinating water molecule
as far as qubit coherence is concerned. Thus, we expect that this
manuscript will encourage to undertake future investigations to
, as well as similar related coordination
compounds, to become a quantumprocessor and howto improve
The datasets generated for this study are available on request to
LE-M developed the model to quantify electron magnetic noise
in molecular spin qubits and conducted the calculations for
. LE-M and JB contributed to write and revise
The present work has been funded by the EU (ERC-2014-
CoG-647301 DECRESIM, COST Action CA15128 MOLSPIN),
by the Spanish MINECO (grant CTQ2015-66223-C2-2-P, grant
CTQ2017-89993 coﬁnanced by FEDER, grant MAT2017-89528,
and Unit of excellence María de Maeztu MDM-2015-0538), and
by the Generalitat Valenciana (Prometeo Programof Excellence).
JB acknowledges the EU for a Marie Curie Fellowship (H2020-
